required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of PEG-rhG-CSF in Preventing Neutropenia in Children With Tumor After Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Pegylated Recombinant Human Granulocyte-colony Stimulating Factor(PEG-rhG-CSF) in Preventing Neutropenia in Children With Tumor After Chemotherapy：A Multi-center, Single Arm Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to evaluate the safety of PEG-rhG-CSF in the prevention of neutropenia in children with tumor after chemotherapy, and then evaluate the effectiveness of PEG-rhG-CSF in preventing neutropenia in children with tumor after chemotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: The dosage was determined according to the patient's weight, 100 UG / kg each time; The method of administration: subcutaneous injection; The time of administration: 24-48 hours after the end of chemotherapy, once in each chemotherapy cycle.

primary_outcome.measure: safety of PEG-rhG-CSF in the prevention of neutropenia in children with tumor after chemotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of observation to the end of observation（6 weeks) of the last enrolled patient
primary_outcome.description: The incidence and severity of adverse events;

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the effectiveness of PEG-rhG-CSF in preventing neutropenia in children with tumor after chemotherapy.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the beginning of observation to the end of observation（6 weeks) of the last enrolled patient
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of grade III / IV ANC reduction in each chemotherapy cycle

arm_group.description: pegylated recombinant human granulocyte-colony stimulating factor subcutaneous injection

intervention.intervention_name: pegylated recombinant human granulocyte-colony stimulating factor
intervention.description: The dosage was determined according to the patient's weight, 100 UG / kg each time; The method of administration: subcutaneous injection; The time of administration: 24-48 hours after the end of chemotherapy, once in each chemotherapy cycle.
